<div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>The goal is to give start and end limit and the # of numbers to generate. For instance I want to generate 100 random numbers between 1-100.</p>
<p>How do I make sure that I don't get <code>ValueError</code> exception?</p>
<p>The code I am using is:</p>
<pre><code>nums = random.sample(range(1000, 2000), 1999)
</code></pre>
</div>
<div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>The error is pretty clear:</p>
<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; nums = random.sample(range(1000, 2000), 1999)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "&lt;stdin&gt;", line 1, in &lt;module&gt;
  File "/Users/mjpieters/Development/venvs/stackoverflow-3.6/lib/python3.6/random.py", line 317, in sample
    raise ValueError("Sample larger than population or is negative")
ValueError: Sample larger than population or is negative
</code></pre>
<p>Your <code>range()</code> only holds 1000 elements:</p>
<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; len(range(1000, 2000))
1000
</code></pre>
<p><code>random.sample()</code> takes <strong>unique values</strong> from an input sequence, and thus can only pick up to <code>len(input)</code> elements in the first place. There are only 1000 unique values in your <code>range()</code>, you can't pick nearly 2000 unique values in random order from that.</p>
<p>If you wanted to generate 100 random numbers between two values, don't use <code>sample()</code>. Use a list comprehension and <a href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/random.html#random.randrange" rel="noreferrer"><code>random.randrange()</code></a> or <a href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/random.html#random.randint" rel="noreferrer"><code>random.randint()</code></a>:</p>
<pre><code>[random.randint(1, 100) for _ in range(100)]
</code></pre>
<p>This will produce 100 random numbers, repetitions allowed.</p>
<p>Even if repetition isn't allowed, to produce a sample of N elements out of a population of N it is better to use a <em>random shuffle</em>:</p>
<pre><code># the numbers 1 - 101, randomly distributed
result = list(range(1, 101))
random.shuffle(result)
</code></pre>
</div>
<div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Are you looking for <a href="https://docs.python.org/2/library/random.html#random.shuffle" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><code>random.shuffle</code></a>? It will give you every element of the range exactly once, in a random order:</p>
<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; import random
&gt;&gt;&gt; l = list(range(1000,2000))
&gt;&gt;&gt; random.shuffle(l)
&gt;&gt;&gt; l
[1096, 1434, 1564, 1503, 1213, 1484, 1340, 1729, 1262, 1663, 1684, 1609, 1464, 1902, 1302, 1767, 1860, 1733, 1009, 1735, 1445, 1429, 1448, 1665, 1551, 1426, 1755, 1790, 1108, 1891, 1121, 1325, 1600, 1230, 1315, 1191, 1243, 1074, 1107, 1865, 1179, 1198, 1169, 1830, 1798, 1727, 1147, 1890, 1092, 1451, 1048, 1638, 1598, 1888, 1807, 1324, 1682, 1589, 1884, 1433, 1130, 1348, 1662, 1215, 1444, 1387, 1897, 1758, 1043, 1372, 1155, 1032, 1487, 1509, 1806, 1602, 1093, 1220, 1772, 1531, 1804, 1746, 1292, 1694, 1556, 1517, 1943, 1582, 1547, 1989, 1966, 1915, 1833, 1276, 1988, 1887, 1320, 1339, 1605, 1951, 1040, 1327, 1336, 1128, 1757, 1538, 1131, 1116, 1142, 1960, 1250, 1307, 1595, 1139, 1576, 1059, 1627, 1633, 1639, 1438, 1252, 1584, 1090, 1272, 1353, 1683, 1163, 1773, 1004, 1658, 1174, 1617, 1913, 1072, 1528, 1530, 1782, 1958, 1342, 1105, 1453, 1416, 1185, 1737, 1015, 1244, 1800, 1366, 1739, 1373, 1533, 1505, 1964, 1996, 1731, 1622, 1742, 1847, 1720, 1263, 1568, 1971, 1667, 1591, 1545, 1953, 1686, 1112, 1935, 1461, 1436, 1894, 1920, 1391, 1673, 1650, 1482, 1197, 1314, 1613, 1479, 1527, 1352, 1186, 1467, 1834, 1948, 1878, 1011, 1911, 1087, 1264, 1333, 1323, 1776, 1266, 1907, 1178,
